page.title: 15HORSES ON WHITE LODGE STUD
page.content: White Lodge Stud Farm feed their horses on hay and a mix of barley and oats in the winter and grass in the summer. They also have vitamins to make their bones stronger so they can win races. The horses go to Geoffrey Wragg in Newmarket for training. They have to go in a trailor. To get them used to going up dangerous trailor ramps, there is a bank on the stud that slowly gets steeper, and if they are going to fall, there is a board to stop them. They then walk straight into the box and the valuable horses are not hurt. They stay with Mr Wragg until they are about 4 yrs old. The max. age for a horse is 25-27yrs. When the mares retire from racing they meet stallions to have foals. The mare has to mind the foal doesn't hit the wall of the stable as she pushes. A horse is pregnant for 11months from Jan-Mar.
